comments.body: i think that already exists
i think that already exists
Було б чудово бачити рейдерів в Bedrock
This would be for Bedrock
very true
This is a great idea for Minecraft.

Item frames on java are entities, I think, allowing them to occupy the same air cube space as other item frames. This is why java can have infinity rooms of total white maps and bedrock cannot. The corners can be filled. Please bring this feature to bedrock.
I don't know why it wasn't this from the very beginning... ?
Hopefully it will patch.

Why does this have fewer votes than the other feedback suggesting the other way around (Item frames becoming blocks in Java edition)? This is good as it allows the majority of players to follow many build hacks on Youtube as most regular players play Bedrock. In contrast, the majority of content creators play Java.
I really don't get why they decided to make them blocks in Bedrock, it just heavilly limits what you can make with them. Performance isn't a good excuse for this.
would be great for large, item frame-based maps that stretch across the floor and walls as well as matrix rooms and build hacks with blocks placed on top of item frames.

amazing  idea, I have always hated the ugly sprint  jumping animation in bedrock and I don't understand how the devs have not fixed it for years now. this is one of many reasons i moved over to java edition. the animations on bedrock are much much uglier. in my opinion then java edition.
sprint jumping does look pretty weird

Arreglen la animación de esprintar y saltar a la vez por favor!! Ya arreglaron el sonido de golpes críticos, ahora solo falta esto. El personaje de ve horrible, y más todavia con vibrant visuals al ver tu sombra.
Heavily agree on this
This, please.

While I primarily play Bedrock and appreciate features like this, changing the way redstone dust connects to pistons will break thousands of contraptions where redstone dust intentionally runs next to a piston without powering it. If some people are already getting upset about them changing the dot to a cross, there will be a riot by the redstone community if this was changed.
Do not do this. This would break nearly every single redstone build that requires pistons. There would be such an outrage.
I play both java and bedrock and do Redstone in both and I think that this would be an amazing thing to add to minecraft.

Bedrock should change so that redstone doesn't connect to pistons. It doesn't connect to lamps, why should it connect to pistons? They changed established mechanics for no reason and should change them back.
Seconded. It is frustrating and the subtle timing difference makes it more likely for me to stay in game and enjoy different types of builds based around fishing.
This is a great idea, actually came to suggest it myself. I also noticed that on bedrock I get way more "Treasure" type loot, compared to Java where I fish up stacks of fish with no treasure.
For now, you can head into the options.txt file, find "gfx_max_framerate" and set the number to whichever you like.

Back in the past, there were "testing"/"experimental" options which were added to be tested, of these was a "fps limit" setting, this still exists in the game, but requires a resource pack to enable, while I can't give you a link, you can search around for something like this, most likely under "secret settings".

Before I thought it was smart that you couldn't click on the armor if you already were wearing that piece. Now I realize that it's way less convenient than clicking twice to put the piece back on if it was better.
This is now possible on Java. This is also a thing in Bedrock.

As there is a command in Bedrock, /MobEvent (and this is more or less asking for that without calling it out by name) I'm going to move this over to Parity.

Thanks for your contribution.

I was not aware of the `/MobEvent` command in Bedrock.
Yes, that would solve my problem in the Java edition exactly.

Thank you, Nova.

The reason Raids are so difficult is because they are supposed to be a middle- to end- game boss fight, which is why they have the boss bar. However, I do think Java players should be able to turn off Raids.
Perhaps a gamerule instead of a weirdly separate command?

@ZillionBeret512

They're not middle to end game though.

They spawn about every other minecraft day (at least in mine) and as early as the 5th day, when I still only have basic iron gear and haven't had time to surround my entire village with an impenetrable wall.

And not being able to kill the raid captain, to avoid triggering the raid, makes it that much more difficult, because while you're trying to find creative ways to kill him without it counting, he's going around killing your villagers.

Basically, I just hate all my villagers dying off. They're already hard enough to get to breed, as nothing ever seems to work for me and they refuse to breed.

I play together with my daughter and its awful to have raids in the beginning, when we have no gear etc.

Please make it an option to turn raids on or off in the game!

What you may be thinking of are Illager Patrols. These should be easily disabled, but raids are entirely different. You can control when a raid happens, simply by not going into a village while having the Bad Omen status effect.

Was breeding a village. Got too close to a patrol that came in. Started a raid of some sorts. I think it's over but noo.. more of them. Then a iron rino??? Got it barehanded after dying 20 times - cuz lost everything in the first fight. Then some witches now flying demons and I'm spawning in the middle of the village where I placed a bed next to the bell to breed villagers. I can't run. i can't fight. I'm in a recurring nightmare. Are they flying demons???!!! I spent so much time on this world and now I can't access it due to a never ending bloodbath. NOT FUN.  I'm not happy i can't end it and keep building after doing so much...
You can prevent raids by not killing a Pillager captain, or when doing so, drinking milk right afterward

ZillionBeret512 was correct, I was thinking of "illager patrols", not the raids specifically, and since my original post, there has been an update to the Java version that can turn these off, so thank you everyone. :)
lol i have pe and like the barrier
i like the barrier so i don't have to take 999999 hours flying up when i go to low
The void is supposed to kill you even in creative mode, so you would die rather than falling forever.
It should have a debug screen
We need this
Please everyone, we can come together as a team and make a difference.

fireworks do appear after victory, i learnt this after i completed a raid and proceeded to watch my entire village all kill themselves at the same time using the fireworks

This needs to be fixed, it's really annoying making a skin that relies on transparency only for it to be opaque on bedrock
The fact that Java players don't have this just seems silly.
So item frames should be entities like in Java?
No, item frames should be placeable no matter what other item frames are in the block.
I agree, we need this. I made a similar suggestion but idk why it got deleted.
yes pls. i just found out you can't even put sea pickles on upside down stairs either! i also tried putting a skeleton head on an end rod to make a lamp and nope... doesn't work :/
Absolutely agree, this needed to be fixed ages ago. This makes potions and turtle helmets kind of worthless.

Its not only useful for Vanilla Minecraft but also for Mod packs with Origins! Water Breathing Origins! Not only that, I would of built Atlantis if I didn't have this issue with the air pocket doors! Imagine the streets of an underwater city but then you see air pockets wherever you go, it just doesn't look good

This is something that has bothered me for a while. Doors creating air pockets instead of waterlogging is, to me, horrible game design. 6 planks should not completely invalid a potion, 2 enchantments, and a piece of armor.

With the current system, if I see an ore on the wall underwater, I can place a few pieces of cobblestone and a door to create an air bubble so I don't get restricted by the underwater mining penalty. This entirely removes the need to enchant with Aqua Affinity.

Why would I craft a Turtle Helmet, enchant with Respiration, or brew a Water Breathing Potion if I can just place a door down and get the same effect? Doors stack and aren't on a timer so I get unlimited time underwater.

The air caused by doors also means that underwater structures, like monuments and shipwrecks, could be completed minutes within starting a new world rather than requiring the player to build up and come back later once they're truly prepared to explore the ocean.

Doors in Bedrock do get waterlogged and don't create the air pockets. This is the way things should be as it's more balanced game design wise and more realistic to how doors are in the real world.

Just some thoughts.

Bumping this up for Mounts of Mayhem.

Java players would literally swim circles around the Nautilus Jockeys.

I made a private minecraft server for me and my friends and I want the name of my weapons get listed in the death message. It would be very nice and the name of the death message is already in the en_US.lang document.
This issue aren't parity, this had to be beta feedback
this better too with crit sound

I disagree, it should be the other way around. Having to craft a shovel for the oars is nothing but an inconvenience to the player on Bedrock Edition, and the simpler recipe on Java Edition is much more convenient to craft at any given time.

Heck, I'm pretty sure Java Edition had the Shovel recipe for a brief period of time, but removed it for player convenience not long after.
It makes sense. But it also makes boats a pain to craft
It has to be the opposite, it makes more sense in Bedrock but it makes you use a lot more wood for something that you'll most likely leave ther
